alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Polk County Lower Elevations; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 5:35PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Polk and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 535 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Mena Intermountain Airport to near Opal to near Hartley. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oden... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Shady... Caney Creek Wilderness... Opal... Mimosa... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Big Fork... Board Camp... Pine Ridge... Cherry Hill in Polk County... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western Arkansas.
